text: The 1964 Milan–San Remo cycling race took place on March 19, 1964, and was won by Peugeot-BP-Englebert's Tom Simpson, becoming the first British winner. It was the 55th edition of the Milan–San Remo "monument" classic race. Simpson set a record pace for the event at 43.420km/h. ==Results== {| class="wikitable" |- style="background:#ccccff;" ! !Cyclist !Team !Time |- |1 | |Peugeot-BP-Englebert | align=right| 6h 37' 59" |- |2 | |Mercier-Hutchinson | align=right| +2" |- |3 | |Flandria-Romeo | align=right| +1' 1" |- |4 | |Solo-Superia | align=right| +1' 9" |- |5 | |Peugeot-BP-Englebert | align=right| s.t. |- |6 | |Margnat-Paloma | align=right| s.t. |- |7 | |Ignis | align=right| s.t. |- |8 | |Solo-Superia | align=right| s.t. |- |9 | |Peugeot- BP-Englebert | align=right| s.t. |- |10 | |Wiel's-Groene Leeuw | align=right| s.t. |} ==References== Category:Milan–San Remo Milan - San Remo, 1964 Milan - San Remo Category:March 1964 sports events Category:1964 Super Prestige Pernod
